title: [BUG] cannot import name '_take_along_axis' from 'sklearn.utils.fixes'
body:
**Describe the bug**

I am getting this error when running an example from your documentation. 

`ImportError: cannot import name '_take_along_axis' from 'sklearn.utils.fixes' (/Users/safishajjouz/opt/anaconda3/envs/Spyder_env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sklearn/utils/fixes.py)`


**To Reproduce**

Here is a MWE


```python
from sktime.datasets import load_airline
from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import (
     ExpandingWindowSplitter,
     ForecastingGridSearchCV,
     ExpandingWindowSplitter)
from sktime.forecasting.naive import NaiveForecaster

y = load_airline()
fh = [1,2,3]
cv = ExpandingWindowSplitter(
     start_with_window=True,
     fh=fh)
forecaster = NaiveForecaster()
param_grid = {"strategy" : ["last", "mean", "drift"]}
gscv = ForecastingGridSearchCV(
     forecaster=forecaster,
     param_grid=param_grid,
     cv=cv)
gscv.fit(y)
ForecastingGridSearchCV(...)
y_pred = gscv.predict(fh)
```

**Expected behavior**

The expected behaviour should be the same output as [here](https://www.sktime.org/en/latest/api_reference/modules/auto_generated/sktime.forecasting.model_selection.ForecastingGridSearchCV.html):

**Versions**
 
```
System:
    python: 3.8.8 (default, Apr 13 2021, 12:59:45)  [Clang 10.0.0 ]
executable: /Users/safishajjouz/opt/anaconda3/envs/Spyder_env/bin/python
   machine: macOS-10.16-x86_64-i386-64bit

Python dependencies:
          pip: 21.0.1
   setuptools: 52.0.0.post20210125
      sklearn: 0.24.2
       sktime: 0.7.0
  statsmodels: 0.12.2
        numpy: 1.19.5
        scipy: 1.5.4
       Cython: 0.29.23
       pandas: 1.2.4
   matplotlib: 3.3.4
       joblib: 1.0.1
        numba: 0.53.1
     pmdarima: None
      tsfresh: 0.18.0
```
-->

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
